text: Paolo Veronese (1528 â€“ 19 April 1588) was an Italian painter of the Renaissance. He was a Venetian. He is remembered for paintings such as The Wedding at Cana and The Feast in the House of Levi. He became known as "Veronese" from his birthplace in Verona. His best works are elaborate narratives. These are executed in a dramatic and colorful Mannerist style. They are full of majestic architectural settings and pageantry. His large paintings of biblical feasts are especially notable. == Gallery == File:Paolo Veronese 041.jpg|Iseppo and Adriano da Porto Academia - Assumption of the Virgin by Veronese cat 541.jpg|Assumption of the Virgin File:Sacrifice of Isaac (Veronese).jpg|Sacrifice of Isaac File:Paolo Veronese, The Wedding at Cana.JPG|Wedding at Cana File:The Feast in the House of Levi by Paolo Veronese (edited 2).jpg|Feast in the House of Levi File:Paolo Veronese - Feast at the House of Simon - WGA24872.jpg|Feast in the House of Simon == Related pages == * Hercules Room * List of Italian painters Category:16th-century Italian painters Category:1528 births Category:1588 deaths
title: Paolo Veronese
